result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel R Osornio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
November 24, 2020 Sentencing
Reporter: Karen Blair

02:32 PM Defendant Samuel R Osornio appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Sarah M Schmeiser appeared by video means for Defendant Samuel R Osornio.
Court questions defendant who has no objection to holding today's hearing by phone/video.
Both counsel have received the revocation packet and are prepared to proceed today.
Atty Burdon requests 18 months confinement followed by 18 months extended supervision with 203 days credit. 
Atty Schmeiser requests 1 year jail or in the alternative, 1 year confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision.  Believes there should be 3 days credit.  

BY THE COURT:
Ct 1:  Court sentences defendant to 3 years in the Wisconsin Prison System, 1 year Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision, consecutive to any other sentence now serving.  Sentence to commence immediately.  Granted 330 days credit. 
Conditions:
*Any amount still due and owing is to be converted to a civil judgment
*Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration and the Earned Release Program.
Address Updated

Telephone conference on February 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF27, 15CF85 & 15CM173 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the revocation packet.  Atty Hendee states that the underwriter did not include Ct. 1 in 15CF85 as this was a DPA that was revoked on August 18th.  Atty Henney received a copy of the revocation packet and have no changes.  
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has been sentenced now on the Adams County cases.  Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  
Atty Henney makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  
14CF27: Court orders 3 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 2 years Initial Confinement and 1 year Extended Supervision with conditions; concurrent to Adams County sentence and any other sentence the court orders:
Credit = 241 days
Court Costs = $268.00
Restitution to be paid through Probation or Extended Supervision
Comply with any and all treatment recommended by the Agent
Comliance with all rules and regulations while on Extended Supervision
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

15CF85:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentece; 24 months Probation with conditions; consecutive to the sentence the court is imposing:
Credit = 126 days if revoked
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
Ct. 2:  Court orders 9 months in the Marquette County Jail; concurrent to any other sentence
Court Costs = $268.00

15CM173:  Court orders 9 months in the Marquette County Jail; concurrent to any other sentence
Court Costs = $243.00

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 23, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on October 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the DPA based on the defendant did not successfully complete the treatment court program.  Atty Henney states that the defendant is not contesting the termination of the DPA.  Atty Henney states that the defendant has a revocation hearing on Sept. 26th.   

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the motion to terminate the DPA and finds the defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.
Set for Status.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Affidavit in Support of Motion and Motion to Terminate DPA
Notice of Motion and Motion to Terminate DPA
Motion hearing on August 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge appears in court.
Atty Hendee states the motion is to terminate the defendant from the Treatment Court Program.  Atty Henney states that he was prepared to argue the termination but due to the Probation revocation; the argument is basically a mute point.  Atty Hendee responds and asks the court to terminate the defendant from the Treatment Court Program and states that the State will be asking to terminate the DPA in the matter also; Atty Hendee asks for sentencing on all the matters.

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the request to terminate Mr. Osornio from the Treatment Court Program.
Set for Motion to terminate.
bond continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Atty Timothy Henney - SBN:  1016217

In Support of Motion to terminate from Treatment Court
- filed by Atty Hendee

to terminate from Treatment Court
filed by Atty Hendee
Defendant was picked up on warrant and appeared in Court; warrant quashed.
Motion hearing on July 20, 2016 at 11:30 am.
*No special conditions

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM173 tracking
Atty Hendee states that the defendant failed to appear for treatment court and all of his treatment . Atty Hendee filed a motion for termination of the treatment court program and a copy was sent to Atty Henney.  
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant gives new address.  Court asks why he did not appear for the treatment court dates.  Defendant states that he had a falling out with his sister and he was kicked out so he couldn't get here.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant is on a probation hold right now for our county and Adams County.  Atty Hendee requests a $5,000 cash bond to cover both cases.
Mr. Osornio asks for the cash to be lowered.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $3,000 cash bond with conditions.
Court will set a Motion Hearing.
Warrant quashed.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was set for Treatment Court review and also the defendant did not appear at the last court date.  Atty Hendee requests a bench Warrant based on non-appearance of the defendant from the last hearing on June 9, 2016.  

BY THE COURT:  Mr. Osornio did receive notice of the June 9th hearing; Court grants the bench warrant based on non-appearance of that June 9th date.

- Mr. Osornio didn't show at Treatment Court so did not get notice.
Treatment Court Hearing on June 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Treatment Court Hearing on May 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Treatment Court Plea Agreement
Deferred Prosecution Agreement s/BNB/5-4-16
Treatment Court Hearing on May 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea to all the charges in 15CF85 & 15CM173.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
 
 
  BY THE COURT:  Court relies on the probable cause section of the information in both cases for a factual basis.  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2 in 15CF85 and Ct. 1 in 15CM173.  
Court approves the 24 month DPA on Ct. 1 in 15CF85.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Henney makes sentencing arguments.  
  State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1, 15CF85:  Court approves & signs the 24 month DPA with conditions.
Court will add a condition per agreement of counsel of Restitution of $115.50 ordered in 15CM173 will need to be paid in full
Court approves the Treatment Court Program agreement

Ct. 2 15CF85 & Ct. 1 in 15CM173:  TREATMENT COURT:   Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*9 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber, conditional time on Ct. 1 in 15CM173; stayed and may be used for Treatment Court violations
*Court Costs = $ 243.00 on each count
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge, on each count
*Restitution in 15CM173 = $105.00 + $10.50 surcharge = $115.50 
*Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
*Participation in the Treatment Court Program

Credit (only if revoked) will be determined by stipulation between Atty Hendee and Atty Henney

Atty Hendee asks that the defendant report to Ms. Runge today after he is released and also asks that the defendant appear for treatment court hearings tomorrow at 1:00pm.
BY THE COURT:  Defendant is released today.
Defendant is to report to Ms. Runge today after he is released and also asks that the defendant appear for treatment court hearings tomorrow at 1:00pm.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
  Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge appears in court.
15CF85 & 15CM173 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Henney; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and will be entering a plea.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant will be entering into the Treatment Court Program.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2 in 15CF85 & Ct. 1 in 15CM173.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 24 months with conditions on Ct. 1 in 15CF85.
Court questions Atty Henney regarding restitution in the DPA.  Atty Henney agrees with the Restitution being a part of the DPA.

Atty Henney agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Henney states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Henney enters a No Contest plea to each of the charges.

Defendant Samuel R Osornio by video with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Samuel R Osornio in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also heard with 15CM173.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz states he will not be on this case but the public defender will be appointing counsel.  Requests initial appearance be set.  Atty Hendee requests $2,500 cash bond to cover both cases.  Atty Gumz responds.  Requests a small cash bond on 15CM173 and a $500 cash bond on 15CF85.
